```{r}
#data pre processing
#extract genres columns from dataset
movie_genre <- as.data.frame(movie_data$genres, stringsAsFactors=FALSE)
library(data.table)

#Select movie genres and split the strings in each column
movie_genre2 <- as.data.frame(tstrsplit(movie_genre[,1], '[|]', 
                                   type.convert=TRUE), #convert data into appropriate data type
                         stringsAsFactors=FALSE) #DataFlair
#rename column names to numbers 1-10
colnames(movie_genre2) <- c(1:10)

list_genre <- c("Action", "Adventure", "Animation", "Children", "Comedy", "Crime","Documentary",
                "Drama", "Fantasy","Film-Noir", "Horror", "Musical", "Mystery","Romance",
                "Sci-Fi", "Thriller", "War", "Western")
#initialize matrix
genre_mat1 <- matrix(0,10330,18)
genre_mat1[1,] <- list_genre
colnames(genre_mat1) <- list_genre

#assign binary indicators for presence of genres
for (index in 1:nrow(movie_genre2)) {
  for (col in 1:ncol(movie_genre2)) {
    gen_col = which(genre_mat1[1,] == movie_genre2[index,col]) #Author DataFlair
    genre_mat1[index+1,gen_col] <- 1}
}

#convert matric into data frame
genre_mat2 <- as.data.frame(genre_mat1[-1,], stringsAsFactors=FALSE) #remove first row, which was the genre list

#covert data from characters to integers
for (col in 1:ncol(genre_mat2)) {
  genre_mat2[,col] <- as.integer(genre_mat2[,col]) 
} 
str(genre_mat2)

```
```{r}
#create search matrix
searchmatrix <- cbind(movie_data[,1:2], genre_mat2[])
head(searchmatrix)

#reformat matrix
ratingmatrix <- dcast(rating_data, userId~movieId, value.var = "rating", na.rm = FALSE)
#convert rating matrix to sparse matrix
ratingmatrix <- as.matrix(ratingmatrix[,-1]) #remove user IDs
ratingmatrix <- as(ratingmatrix, "realRatingMatrix")
ratingmatrix
```

```{r}
#find most viewed movies using rating numbers
library(ggplot2)

#count views for each movie then create dataframe
movie_views <- colCounts(ratingmatrix) 
table_views <- data.frame(movie = names(movie_views),
                          views = movie_views)
#sort by number of views in decreasing order 
table_views <- table_views[order(table_views$views, decreasing = TRUE),]
table_views$title <- NA

#populate title columns with movie titles
for (index in 1:10325) {
  table_views[index,3] <- as.character(subset(movie_data, movie_data$movieId == table_views[index, 1])$title)
}
table_views[1:6,]

#visualize bar chart for total number of views for top films
ggplot(table_views[1:6,], aes(x = title, y = views)) + 
  geom_bar(stat="identity", fill = 'steelblue') +
  geom_text(aes(label=views), vjust=-0.3, size=3.5) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +
  ggtitle("Total Views of the Top Films")

#heatmap of movie ratings
image(ratingmatrix[1:20, 1:25], axes = FALSE, main = "Heatmap of first 25 rows and columns")
```
```{r}
#filter ratingmatrix to include movies with over 50 views and users that have rated over 50 movies
movie_ratings <- ratingmatrix[rowCounts(ratingmatrix) > 50,
                             colCounts(ratingmatrix) > 50]
movie_ratings

#calculate 98th percentile of movie ratings and users
minimum_movies <- quantile(rowCounts(movie_ratings), 0.98)
minimum_users <- quantile(colCounts(movie_ratings), 0.98)
#create heatmap of most active users and most popular movies
image(movie_ratings[rowCounts(movie_ratings) > minimum_movies,
                     colCounts(movie_ratings) > minimum_users],
main = "Heatmap of the top users and movies")

```
```{r}
#visualize distributions of average ratings per user

average_ratings <- rowMeans(movie_ratings)
qplot(average_ratings, fill = I("pink"), col = I("black")) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of average rating per user")
```
```{r}
#normalize data to remove bias
normalized_ratings <- normalize(movie_ratings)
sum(rowMeans(normalized_ratings) > 0.00001)
image(normalized_ratings[rowCounts(normalized_ratings) > minimum_movies,
                          colCounts(normalized_ratings) > minimum_users],
main = "Normalized Ratings of the Top Users")

```
```{r}
#convert to binary data: 1 if rating is above 3 and 0 if rating is below
binary_min_movies <- quantile(rowCounts(movie_ratings), 0.95)
binary_min_users <- quantile(colCounts(movie_ratings), 0.95)

highly_rated <- binarize(movie_ratings, minRating = 3)
image(highly_rated[rowCounts(movie_ratings) > binary_min_movies, colCounts(movie_ratings) > binary_min_users], main = "Heatmap of top movies and users")
```
```{r}
#randomly sample rows from movie_ratings matrix
sampled_data <- sample(x = c(TRUE, FALSE),
                       size = nrow(movie_ratings),
                       replace = TRUE,
                       prob = c(0.8, 0.2))
#training data set (80% of data)
training_data <- movie_ratings[sampled_data,]

#testing data set for validation (20% of data)
testing_data <- movie_ratings[!sampled_data,]

recommendation_system <- recommenderRegistry$get_entries(dataType = "realRatingMatrix")
recommendation_system$IBCF_realRatingMatrix$parameters
```
```{r}
#create item based collaborative filtering model
recommend_model <- Recommender(data = training_data,
                          method = "IBCF",
                          parameter = list(k = 30))
recommend_model
#check the class of the "recommend_model" object
class(recommend_model)
```
```{r}
#retrieve recommend_model
#find class and dimensions of similarity matrix from within model_info
model_info <- getModel(recommend_model)
class(model_info$sim)
dim(model_info$sim)
top_items <- 20
#visualize similarity between top 20 items
image(model_info$sim[1:top_items, 1:top_items],
   main = "Heatmap of the first rows and columns")

sum_rows <- rowSums(model_info$sim > 0)
table(sum_rows)

#visualize sum of columns through distribution
sum_cols <- colSums(model_info$sim > 0)
qplot(sum_cols, fill=I("pink"), col=I("black"))+ ggtitle("Distribution of the column count")
```
```{r}
top_recommendations <- 10 # the number of items to recommend to each user
predicted_recommendations <- predict(object = recommend_model,
                          newdata = testing_data,
                          n = top_recommendations)
predicted_recommendations

user1 <- predicted_recommendations@items[[1]] # recommendation for the first user
movies_user1 <- predicted_recommendations@itemLabels[user1]
movies_user2 <- movies_user1
for (index in 1:10){
  movies_user2[index] <- as.character(subset(movie_data,
                                         movie_data$movieId == movies_user1[index])$title)
}
movies_user2
```


```{r}
# Prompt the user for a User ID
user_input <- as.integer(readline(prompt = "Enter your User ID: "))

# Check if the User ID exists in the testing dataset
if (!is.na(user_input) && user_input %in% rownames(testing_data)) {
  # Generate recommendations for the entered User ID
  user_recommendations <- predict(recommend_model, 
                                  newdata = testing_data[user_input, , drop = FALSE], 
                                  n = top_recommendations)  # Top 10 recommendations
  
  # Extract recommended movie IDs
  recommended_items <- user_recommendations@items[[1]]
  
  # Get movie titles from the movie_data dataset
  recommended_movies <- sapply(recommended_items, function(movie_id) {
    as.character(subset(movie_data, movieId == movie_id)$title)
  })
  
  # Display the recommendations
  cat("\nRecommended Movies for User", user_input, ":\n")
  print(recommended_movies)
} else {
  # Handle invalid User ID input
  cat("Invalid User ID or User ID not found in the testing dataset. Please try again.\n")
}

```
